text: @eid_0c373165 created this channel on 2026-12-22 09:14:00. This is the very beginning of the bug-georgegarcia-CollaborateForce channel.
@eid_0c373165 joined bug-georgegarcia-CollaborateForce. Also, @eid_76d9cb07, @eid_13df35ed, @eid_a7dd9c52, @eid_a8040636, @eid_b3fcc490, @eid_df7ae03e, @eid_446bc3ee joined via invite.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with CollaborateForce that need our attention. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have the 'Rate Limiting Misalignment' issue. External applications are facing unexpected rate limiting, which is impacting the API Authentication Layer. This is causing frustration for developers as they can't integrate seamlessly. Impacted customer: CUST-0040.

Next, there's the 'Delayed Data Propagation' issue. Users are experiencing significant delays in data updates from the database to the UI, which could lead to miscommunication during collaborative sessions. Affected customer: CUST-0052.

Lastly, we have a 'Token Expiry Mismanagement' issue. Session tokens aren't being invalidated properly after logout, posing a security risk. This affects the Security Module and could expose sensitive data. Impacted customer: CUST-0094.
All these issues are assigned to @eid_76d9cb07. Can you confirm you'll take these on? Let me know if you need any additional info! üëç
Thanks for the heads-up, @eid_0c373165! I'll start with the 'Rate Limiting Misalignment' issue. I'll dig into the API Authentication Layer and see what's causing the unexpected rate limiting. üöÄ
For the 'Delayed Data Propagation' issue, I'll check the database and UI integration to identify the bottleneck. Ensuring real-time data updates is crucial for our users. üîç
Regarding the 'Token Expiry Mismanagement', I'll review the Security Module to ensure session tokens are invalidated correctly. Security is a top priority! üîí
I'll keep everyone updated on my progress. If anyone has insights or suggestions, feel free to share! üòä
Great, thanks @eid_76d9cb07! Let us know if you hit any roadblocks. Team, feel free to jump in if you have any ideas or can lend a hand. Let's get these resolved for our customers! üí™
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current issues. Let's take a look and see what we can learn! üòä

First up, we have a 'Rate Limiting Misconfiguration' issue in Django. Developers are facing unexpected rate limiting when using Django's REST framework, similar to our API Authentication Layer problem. Check it out here: https://github.com/django/django/pull/4809
Thanks, George! This sounds a lot like our 'Rate Limiting Misalignment' issue. I'll review their approach and see if we can apply any of their solutions to our API problem. üöÄ

Next, there's a 'Delayed State Update Propagation' issue in React. State changes aren't immediately reflected in the UI, which is causing user confusion. This is quite similar to our 'Delayed Data Propagation' issue. Here's the PR: https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/4810
Interesting! I'll dive into this React issue. Understanding how they handle state updates might give us insights into improving our database and UI integration. üîç

Lastly, there's a 'Session Token Expiry Issue' in OAuth2 Proxy. Session tokens aren't invalidated upon logout, posing a security risk. This mirrors our 'Token Expiry Mismanagement' problem. PR link: https://github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy/pull/4811
Security is crucial! I'll look into how OAuth2 Proxy is addressing this token expiry issue. It might help us tighten our Security Module. üîí
Great, David! Let's keep these open-source solutions in mind as we work on our bugs. Feel free to reach out if you need any help or want to brainstorm ideas. üí™
Will do, George! Thanks for finding these resources. I'll keep everyone updated on any progress or insights. üòä
Hi team, the bug about incorrect token expiry management has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/CollaborateForce/pull/57.
To recap, the issue was that session tokens weren't being invalidated properly after logout, which allowed unauthorized users to reuse them for accessing collaborative features.
The root cause was identified in the security module, where the token revocation list wasn't being updated promptly. This led to stale tokens remaining valid beyond their intended expiry.

To fix this, I implemented a mechanism that triggers an immediate update to the token revocation list whenever a user logs out. This ensures that all tokens are invalidated in real-time, preventing unauthorized access.
Great work, David! Thanks for the quick turnaround on this. @eid_76d9cb07
No problem, George. Let me know if there are any more issues or if further testing is needed.

Hi team, the bug about incorrect rate limiting, titled 'Rate Limiting Misalignment', has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/CollaborateForce/pull/58.

The root cause was a misalignment between our rate limiting configuration in CollaborateForce and the actual API usage patterns. This was further complicated by incorrect client IP address detection, which led to unexpected rate limiting for external applications.
Thanks for the update, David! Can you explain how you fixed it?

Sure thing, @eid_0c373165. We adjusted the rate limiting configuration to better align with the actual usage patterns. Additionally, we fixed the client IP detection logic by updating the IP parsing method to correctly identify and handle proxy headers. This ensures that the correct client IP is used for rate limiting decisions.
Great work, David! This should help reduce the number of denied API requests. Thanks for jumping on this so quickly.
No problem, George. If anyone notices any more issues or has further questions, feel free to reach out!
Hi team, the bug titled 'Delayed Data Propagation' has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/CollaborateForce/pull/59.

To recap, the issue was due to a bottleneck in our data pipeline. Specifically, the message queue responsible for handling data updates was overwhelmed, leading to slower processing times than expected.
Thanks for the update, David! What was the fix you implemented?

Good question, George. We optimized the message queue by increasing its processing capacity and implemented a more efficient batching mechanism for updates. This reduces the load and ensures timely propagation of data to the user interface.
Sounds great! This should really help improve the user experience during collaborative sessions. Thanks for the quick turnaround, @eid_76d9cb07.
No problem, George. Let me know if you notice any further issues or if there's anything else I can assist with.
